dublin_core.dcvalue: Telementoring offers the possibility of making extended education oversight available on a cost effective large scale basis It expands the mentor proctor pool and makes these educational assets more widely available to assist in protecting the public However it is an application that if haphazardly implemented rapidly losses its effectiveness and is more dangerous to the patient Like all programs that can cite demonstrable outcome consistency telementoring should be established on a foundation of sound training methodology This article discusses the history of telementoring and where this modality stands today and outlines a validated methodology for successful telementoring missions
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-10T17:22:38Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2007-07-26
Telementoring: an application whose time has come.
